alert.note: Alert for Finney; Gray; Haskell; Meade (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:37AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Ford, southeastern Finney, southwestern Hodgeman, northwestern Meade, Gray and northeastern Haskell Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 137 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Charleston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Charleston around 140 AM CDT. Ingalls around 155 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cimarron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Kansas.
